column3: You are in a jungle with a beach to one side of you. There is a cave ahead in the distance.
You are inside a dark cave. It is very difficult to see anything.
An open field surrounds you. You are facing a far off swamp with a cave to your side.
You are standing on a beach with the hot sand beneath your feet. You can see a jungle in one direction. There is a forest in another and a stone temple straight ahead.
You are in the middle of a giant stone temple. There is a locked door in the center of the temple with three key holes.
Mud and swamp water come up to your knees. You can see a stone temple at one end of the swamp. There is also a field to your right and a desert on your left.
You are in a dense forest with trees surrounding you. You cannot see any other areas through the thick foliage.
You are walking through an ominous graveyard with bones scattered throughout. A stone temple sits to your left. A desert lies ahead of you. There is also a forest behind you.
You are traveling across a broad desert with the wind blowing sand in your face. You cannot see over the large sand dunes.
You cannot move in that direction.
A skeleton wielding a sword stands before you.
A ravenous zombie is splashing around in the water in front of you.
A goblin holding a knife watches you curiously from the corner of the cave. You can make out what appears to be a key dangling from his makeshift clothes.
You pick up the bandage.
You pick up the med kit.
You pick up the axe.
You pick up the sword.
You pick up the shield.
You put on the armor.
You pick up the key.
You pick up the key.
You pick up the key.
You cannot do that when you are in a fight.
Your inventory is full. You must drop an item to pick up a new one.
You drop the bandage.
You drop the med kit.
You take off your armor.
You drop your shield.
You drop your sword.
You drop your axe.
You drop the skeleton key.
You drop the goblin key.
You drop the zombie key.
You strike the enemy as they attack you. You both take damage.
You killed the enemy.
There is no enemy to attack.
